oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Clover Bottom
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Exterior view of Clover Bottom in Nashville, showing the two-story brick home. The porch on the Italianate style home has square columns with curved moldings, round windows, and a balustrade veranda.
One of the South's most noted estates, scene of the famous horse race between General Andrew Jackson's "Truxten" and Col. Joseph Erwin's "Ploughboy" in 1806.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Dwellings--Tennessee; Architecture, Domestic--Tennessee
Balustrades; Columns; Houses; Moldings
